review_title: Highly Recommend GA Positions at SOU
pros: -Excellent opportunity to learn about a department, practice instruction, and support coursework!
cons: -I wish the program was longer

job_title: Senior Instructor II in Ashland, OR
pros: Employees are incredibly kind, hard-working, supportive, and capable. The University has a great mission and is in a beautiful location.
cons: The pay is very low. Job insecurity is a perpetual challenge, primarily because of funding issues. Students are, in general, arriving less prepared and more demanding.

review_title: Not bad, but could be better.
job_title: Custodial Hospitality Assistant in Ashland, OR
pros: Good people Easy-ish work Variation Satisfaction Reasonable expectations
cons: Poor pay Mediocre training Some poor supervisors Mentally tiring Repetitive

review_title: Lots to do, plan changes all the time and you're responsible
pros: There's so much to do that you'll get a lot of opportunities to learn a wide variety of HR tasks, and connect with other staff and students across the University.
cons: There aren't enough staff to do all the work. The HR director changes the plan for projects mid stream and then will be mad at you for not carrying out the new plan. HR director will read through your emails, chats etc and listen to your phone calls looking for ways that you are making mistakes.

pros: easy schedule, little oversight, little feedback
cons: Leadership was gone for months, then choose one item to micromanage, only slowing down the infrastructure built in their absence. Mixed signals, not transparent.

pros: Some of the nicest and most welcoming colleagues, beautiful campus and location, decent benefits
cons: Everyone is severing underpaid and university is unstable in terms of financial landscape. Departments & programs likely to get cut and if someone quits, likely to not re-hire and will result in someone doing the job of 2 people without extra compensation

job_title: Office Specialist II in Ashland, OR
pros: Opportunity to guide students with their academic journey. Working with like-minded professionals.
cons: Impenetrable barriers between staff and administration. Lack of empathy and genuine positive regard for staff.

pros: positive working environment, great benefits, management
cons: slow growth opportunities, low pay, people who are lazy stay there forever and work their way up

review_title: Great Beni's / Retirement. Could be better pay.
pros:
Great university to work for. 

Great town to work in.

Great Work/Life balance

Everyone is super nice
cons:
Pay could have been better

As you stay longer they "expect" you to take on more work because they rarely back fill jobs and hold them vacant forever.

review_title: Gained tons of experience, boss was a great mentor
pros: Connie and my coworkers at SOU's Student Publicity Center were friendly and helpful. Connie was an awesome boss who taught me a lot about the realities of working in graphic design and helped me develop the skills I'd need to make it after graduation. She also put me on projects that became great opportunities to build my portfolio. As far as on campus jobs go, it also paid well.
cons: Unfortunately, work at the Student Publicity Center is pretty heavily dependent on campus events happening, which meant during the pandemic there wasn't much work.

pros: The area around Ashland is beautiful.
cons:
-No communication between departments
-The wages are not sustainable for the housing market, priced out, and forced to live 
 away from work.
-No major salary increases
-A revolving door of people getting hired and leaving after a few months
-Never student centered, always about the money and how to recruit foreign students
-Administrators are a joke and never listen
-School is in constant financial trouble
-Past trouble with accreditation and fiscal responsibilities

pros: Decent pay most people nice
cons: Politics suck only good for a few individuals not all. Push you to work until you drop or get injured no compassion

pros: Great students, small classes, supportive colleagues
cons: Egregious cost of living / salary ratio.

review_title: Great Part- Time Job for students
pros: flexible work hours, nice staff, availability for more or less hours
cons: lower pay, not many hours

job_title: Office Assistant II in Ashland, OR
pros: Working in a liberal arts University like SOU provided a community of forward thinking, collaborative, and supportive individuals.
cons: The pay wasn't as competitive as working in the private sector, but the benefits were good.

pros: Honest, fair, promotes growth, cares for the individual.
cons: Long hours, lots of studying, material moves fast.

review_title: Solid admissions department to work for
pros: Very friendly coworkers and community to work with.
cons: Other departments seem to put all their work on Admissions when it comes to recruitment efforts.

pros: Warm, inclusive, welcoming beautiful campus
cons: None really. Loved my time there.

pros: Beautiful location in Southern Oregon
cons: Smaller college that is underfunded

job_title: College Art Professor in Portland, OR
pros: Awesome place love it so much
cons: None place is great love it

pros: It is a great place to learn
cons: there are none that I can think of

job_title: Staff Manager/Resident Assistant/Orientation Leader/Parade Chair in Ashland, OR
pros: Lots of different jobs/positions available, works with your school schedule, is often mindful of you being a PERSON and not just an employee, easy to secure a job.
cons: No benefits, can't work over 20 hours a week because the university doesn't want to pay you benefits, you can only hold most positions as a student.

review_title: It's Better Than A Kick In The Teeth
job_title: IT Consultant II in Ashland, OR
pros: Co-workers are great.  The campus is very nice.  Some of the lower management really work for the employees in their department.
cons: Upper management wants to nickel and dime their employees.  Pay is pretty lousy.  The school is always behind in technology.  Because of the low pay, it is very hard to keep good quality employees.

pros: Flexible hours.  Good benefits.
cons: One of the worst universities as far as pay goes.  Similar positions elsewhere pay around 30%-40% more.  You will be overworked and forced to take on duties outside your position description.  Then, after you have completed these extra jobs, there will be zero appreciation, not even a thank you.  There is no incentive to perform, no compensation for doing other peoples jobs, nothing.  This is a terrible place to work and because of that, the turn over rate is pretty high.  All the good employees figure it out and leave pretty quickly.

review_title: An overall average part-time job at a college experience.
pros: Staff were generally friendly and mostly know each other since it's a small school. I had a good boss since she was at her position for a very long time until she left for a better job just before I graduated.
cons: I don't really have much bad to say since I just worked as a part-timer between classes. I think they wanted me to work more hours, yet I always asked for low hours, and they never made that clear to me. I graduated before I realized that.

review_title: Administrators are too worried about the bottom line and not about the students
pros: Helping students was the best part of what I did at SOU. Next to that would be the people I worked with. The area is amazing to live.
cons: The Administration does not focus on their students, they are too worried about cutting programs in order to add more administration positions. The school also pays next to nothing in wages, a position that was a Masters required, was only offered $30,000/year.

review_title: Southern Oregon University, Administration and Budget Woes
pros: Faculty members are topnotch and dedicated.  Academic atmosphere is a great place to work.
cons: Staff must fight for their pay and benefits every year while administration awards themselves raises. Professors and adjuncts are paid at the lowest rung in the U.S.

job_title: Civic Engagement Student Coordinator in Ashland, OR
pros: Working for the university while I was getting my undergrad degree was the perfect arrangement. It allowed me to work around my schedule and become more familiar with the campus, fellow students and community I called home for four years.
cons: The department I was involved in was very dependent on other departments, so coordinating meetings was sometimes difficult, otherwise there was not many cons in this position.

review_title: Great way to make extra money while on campus
pros: Flexible hours, contact with other students, great coworkers
cons: Quite a lot of things to take care of, at first it might be hard to get to know all of the procedures

pros: Plenty of time to work on homework, and the library is close to classes. Definitely one of the better on-campus jobs.
cons: Very few cons to report. Working for circulation can be a drag, but working for reference is a breeze.

review_title: PEAK jobs give real world experience
pros: Gives students real world job experience including self motivation, networking with clients, and practicing skills related to industry
cons: Can only work a small amount of hours because of student employment rules

job_title: Social Media Strategist, Communication Program in Ashland, OR
pros: All members of the Communication program at SOU are passionate about their mission to support student learning and mentoring. They all have great advice and knowledge to share.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros: The university has a very familial feel and this only increases as you begin working with your fellow students, professors, and faculty.
cons: You are no longer eligible to work here once you graduate.

pros: Inclusive community that looks to help you grow asa student and as an adult.
cons: Work load varies quite a bit pending on jobs.

pros: Great people, great location, lots of perks living in Ashland, OR. Worked there 2010-2012.
cons: Low pay (but excellent benefits)

pros: Beautiful area if you like the outdoors. Beautiful campus. Friendly people.
cons: Minimum wage as a tutor.

job_title: Mailroom Student Worker in Ashland, OR
pros: flexible hours, caring supervisors, easy going work pace for the most part
cons: Limited hours available to work

pros: Flexible, good support, and fun!
cons: low pay, some days were really busy, others really slow.
